p: EV-A71 commonly causes hand, foot, and mouth disease in young children. Although patients with this disease are typically asymptomatic or mildly symptomatic, several outbreaks complicated by neurological diseases, such as myocarditis, acute flaccid paralysis, and encephalitis, or deaths, have been reported in the Asia-Pacific region since 1997 [ 4â€“8]. A very recent outbreak involved 74 children at Colorado, USA, in 2018 who presented with neurological manifestations [ 9]. However, other than symptomatic treatments, no treatment for EV-A71 infection is available. Thus, studies to develop anti-EV-A71 agents are urgently needed.
